subject: Re: [junit] Re: Handleing expected excpetion In a @Theory
msgSnippet: Hmm.  This sounds like a bug in JUnit.  Can you post the exact code as a bug report?  In the meantime, you may have to workaround with try {} catch {}.
messageBody:
Hmm. This sounds like a bug in JUnit. Can you post the exact code as
a bug report? In the meantime, you may have to workaround with try {}
catch {}. Thanks,

David Saff

On Tue, Oct 7, 2008 at 3:12 AM, yosefshariat <yosefshariat@...> wrote:
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "David Saff" <david@...> wrote:
>>
>> It's a real hack, but in 4.5 and following, you can use
>>
>> @Theory @Test(expected=SomeClass.class) public void myTest() { ... }
>>
>> Thanks,
>>
>> David Saff
>>
>> On Mon, Oct 6, 2008 at 8:54 AM, yosefshariat <yosefshariat@...> wrote:
>> > Hi
>> > How can I handle exception in a theory of JUnit UnitTest?
>> > I wrote a @Theory and I want use it in UnitTest repeatedly?
>> > Please help me.
>> >
>> >
>>
> Tanks, but how can I add parameter to this Theory?
> I can't add any input parameter to this theory.
> If I add a parameter to this theory, then it throws the following
> exception:
> "java.lang.Exception: Method myTest should have no parameters"
>
>
